sen.j: 伏見駅（ふしみえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区深草柴田屋敷町にある近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Fushimi Station (Fushimi-eki), located in Shibatayashiki-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railroad station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: 近畿日本鉄道→Kintetsu Company [http://www.kintetsu.jp、会社名として]
sen.e: Fushimi Station (Fushimi-eki), located in Shibatayashiki-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railroad facility on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Corporation.
Fushimi Station, located in Shibatayashiki-cho, Fukakusa, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railroad facility on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: Fushimi-eki を削除しました。Fukakusa を追加しました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station structure
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ高架駅。
sen.e: It is an elevated station equipped with opposite platforms with two sides and two tracks.
sen.cmt: 相対式プラットホーム→ opposite platforms [http://yougo.rtri.jp/dic/]、高架駅→elevated station [http://yougo.rtri.jp/dic/]
sen.e: It is an elevated station equipped with opposing platforms, each of which has two sides and two tracks.
It is an elevated station equipped with two separate platforms serving two tracks between them.
sen.cmt: ホーム表現を変更しました。

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: Effective length of the platforms is 6 cars long.
The effective platform length is equal to six cars.
The effective platform length is equal to six cars.

sen.j: 改札・コンコースは1階、ホームは2階にある。
sen.e: The ticket inspection facility and concourse are on the 1st floor and the platforms are on the 2nd floor.
sen.cmt: 改札→ticket inspection facility[http://yougo.rtri.jp/dic/] コンコース→concourse[http://yougo.rtri.jp/dic/]
sen.e: The ticket inspection facility and concourse are on the first floor, and the platforms are on the second floor.
The ticket inspection facility and concourse are on the first floor, and the platforms are on the second floor.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: There is only a ticket barrier.
There is only one ticket barrier.
It has only one ticket gate.
sen.cmt: 改札→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 当駅が高架で建設されたのは、建設当時に当駅北方の国道24号（竹田街道）上に京都市電伏見線（1970年廃止）が走っており、立体交差の必要があったためである。
sen.e: The station was constructed by elevating the railway, because at the time of the construction, the then Kyoto City Fushimi Line (disused in 1970) was running on the National Highway 24 (Takeda-kaido Way) to the north of the station, and it was necessary to replace the existing crossings with overhead crossings.
sen.cmt: 国道24号（竹田街道）→National Highway 24 (Takeda-kaido Way) [小学館プログレッシブ和英, 英辞郎 on the WEB]、京都市電伏見線→Kyoto City Fushimi Line [http://kyoto.trolley.net]、立体交差→overhead crossing [http://yougo.rtri.jp/dic/]
sen.e: The station was constructed by elevating the railway, because at the time of the construction the Kyoto City Fushimi Line (disused in 1970) was running on National Highway 24 (Takeda-kaido Way) to the north of the station, and it was necessary to replace the existing crossings with those of the overhead type.

The station was constructed by elevating the railway, because at the time of the construction the Kyoto City Tram Fushimi Line (disused in 1970) was running on National Route 24 (Takeda-kaido Road) to the north of the station, and it was necessary to replace the existing crossings with those of the overhead type.
sen.cmt: City Tramとしました。国道→national routeとしました。Takeda-kaido Roadとしました。

sen.j: 奈良鉄道～奈良線時代は平面交差であり、両者の衝突事故が何度か起きた。
sen.e: During the time of Nara Railway and when it was a part of the Nara Line, the line had grade crossings and there were several crashes of the trains running on both lines.
During the time of the Nara Railway, when it was a part of the Nara Line, the line had grade crossings and on both lines there were several incidents of train crashes.
During the time of the Nara Railway, when it was a part of the Nara Line, the line had grade crossings and on both lines there were several incidents of train crashes.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automatic ticket gate made by Toshiba are installed.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: A red colored automatic ticket gate (EC-2000) has 2-ticket processing function at outgoing ticket usage check, and accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.
sen.cmt: 出場時→定訳不明「鉄道技術用語辞典(自動改札機の入出場検査→ticket usage check) http://yougo.rtri.org.jp/dic/をもとに、at outgoing ticket usage checkとしました]、2枚一括処理→ (2-ticket processing function [東芝文献（東芝レビュー）：http://www.toshiba.co.jp/tech/review/2000/01/f01.pdf]
sen.e: A red-colored automatic ticket gate (EC-2000) has the two-ticket processing function at the outgoing ticket usage check, and it accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.
A red-colored automatic ticket gate (EG-2000) has the two-ticket processing function at the outgoing ticket usage check, and it accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization situation
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は6,361人。
sen.e: According to the survey carried out on November 8, 2005, the number of the users a day was 6,361.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the number of the users was 6,361.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the number of the users was 6,361.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、101位。
sen.e: This was the 101st position among all the Kintetsu Railway stations targeted by the survey (323 stations, as of the date of the survey).
This was the 101st position among all the Kintetsu Railway stations targeted by the survey (323 as of the survey date).
This was the 101st position among all the Kintetsu Railway stations targeted by the survey (323 as of the survey date).

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、19位。
sen.e: It ranked the 19th out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked nineteenth out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked nineteenth out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、17位。
sen.e: It ranked the 17th out of all the Kintetsu Railway stations within Kyoto City (23 stations).
It ranked seventeenth out of all the Kintetsu Railway stations within Kyoto City (23 stations).
It ranked seventeenth out of all the Kintetsu Railway stations within Kyoto City (23 stations).

sen.j: 国道24号
sen.e: Ｎational Route 24
Ｎational Route 24
National Route 24
sen.cmt: 2バイト文字を修正しました。

sen.j: 京都市立伏見住吉小学校
sen.e: Kyoto City Fushimi Sumiyoshi Elementary School
Kyoto City Fushimi Sumiyoshi Elementary School
Kyoto City Fushimi Sumiyoshi Elementary School

sen.j: 京都教育大学附属高等学校
sen.e: Senior High School attached to Kyoto University of Education
sen.cmt: 京都教育大学附属高等学校→Senior High School attached to Kyoto University of Education [http://www117.sakura.ne.jp/%7Ekyokyofk/index.html]
sen.e: The senior high school attached to the Kyoto University of Education
The senior high school attached to the Kyoto University of Education

sen.j: 京阪本線墨染駅
sen.e: Keihan Main Line Sumizome Station
Keihan Main Line Sumizome Station
Keihan Main Line Sumizome Station

sen.j: 駅北側の柴田屋敷町公園には京都市交通局1800形電車（1829号）が、集会所として保存されている。
sen.e: At Shibatayashiki-cho Park located to the north side of the station, an old-time Kyoto Municipal Traffic Bureau Type 1800 train (No. 1829) is conserved and used as an assembly room.
sen.cmt: 京都市交通局1800形電車（1829号）→定訳不明 [Kyoto Municipal Trafic Bureau Type 1800 (1829) としました]
sen.e: At Shibatayashiki-cho Park located to the north side of the station, an old-time Kyoto Municipal Traffic Bureau Type 1800 train (No. 1829) is conserved and used as an assembly room.
At Shibatayashiki-cho Park located to the north side of the station, an old-time Kyoto Municipal Traffic Bureau Type 1800 train (No. 1829) is conserved and used as an assembly room.

sen.j: 最寄バス停は駅から徒歩5分の竹田街道沿いにある棒鼻となる。
sen.e: The nearest bus stop is Bohana which is situated along the Takeda-kaido Way a 5-minute walk from the station.
The nearest bus stop is Bohana, situated along the Takeda-kaido Way a five-minute walk from the station.
The nearest bus stop is Bohana, situated along the Takeda-kaido Road a five-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: 京都市営バス横大路営業所81号・特81号系統：京都駅行/横大路車庫行
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus Yokooji Office Route 81/Route toku-81: for Kyoto Station/for Yokooji Shako (depot).
sen.cmt: 京都市営バス横大路営業所81号・特81号系統→定訳不明 [Kyoto City Bus Yokooji Office Route 81/Route toku-81としました]
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus Yokooji Office Route 81/Route toku-81: Bound for Kyoto Station/for Yokooji Shako (depot).
Kyoto City Bus Yokooji Office Route 81/Route toku-81: Bound for Kyoto Station/for Yokooji Shako (depot).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月15日 奈良電気鉄道京都駅～桃山御陵前駅間開通時に開業。
sen.e: November 15, 1928: The station was inaugurated when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Kyoto Station and Momoyamagoryomae Station.
sen.cmt: 奈良電気鉄道→Nara Electric Railway [http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/KINKI-NIPPON=RAILWAY-COMPANY-LTD-Company-History.html]
sen.e: November 15, 1928: The station was inaugurated when the Nara Electric Railway began operating between Kyoto Station and Momoyamagoryomae Station.
November 15, 1928: The station was inaugurated when the Nara Electric Railway began operating between Kyoto Station and Momoyamagoryomae Station.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1963: With the merger of the company, it became a station of Kintetsu Railway.
October 1, 1963: It became a station of Kintetsu Railway due to the company merger.
October 1, 1963: It became a station of Kintetsu Railway due to the company merger.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: April 1, 2007: PiTaPa started to be accepted at the station.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became accepted at the station.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became accepted at the station.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 当駅を含む区間は、日本国有鉄道奈良線（旧奈良鉄道&amprarr関西鉄道）が1921年にルート変更する前の路盤を利用して建設されているが、奈良線時代にもほぼ同位置に伏見駅があった。
sen.e: The section including this station in between was constructed making use of the roadbed that the Japan National Railway (JNR) Nara Line (former Nara Railway, which was later transferred to Kansai Railway Company) had been using until the route was changed in 1921, and during the times of Nara Railway, there was also a station at almost the same place.
sen.cmt: 「（旧奈良鉄道&amprarr関西鉄道）」は「&amprarr」の部分が分からなかったのですが、一応「(ｆormer Nara Railway, which was later transferred to Kansai Railway Company)」としました、関西鉄道→Kansai Railway Company [http://www.rtri.or.jp/japanrail/History1_E.html]
sen.e: The section (with this station as a midpoint) was constructed, making use of the road bed that the Japan National Railway (JNR) Nara Line (former Nara Railway, which was later transferred to Kansai Railway Company) had been using until the route was changed in 1921, and during the times of the Nara Railway there was a station at nearly the same place.

The section (with this station as a midpoint) was constructed, making use of the road bed that the Japan National Railways (JNR) Nara Line (former Nara Railway, which was later transferred to Kansai Railway Company) had been using until the route was changed in 1921, and during the times of the Nara Railway there was a station at nearly the same place.
sen.cmt: Japan National Railways としました。

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）9月5日 奈良鉄道により開設。
sen.e: September 5, 1985: The station was opened by Nara Railway.
September 5, 1985: The station was opened by Nara Railway.
September 5, 1895: The station was opened by Nara Railway.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 奈良鉄道が関西鉄道に譲渡。
sen.e: February 7, 1905: Nara Railway was transferred to Kansai Railway Company.
February 7, 1905: The Nara Railway was transferred to the Kansai Railway Company.
February 7, 1905: The Nara Railway was transferred to the Kansai Railway Company.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: October 1, 1907: Kansai Railway Company became subject to the Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: 鉄道国有法→Railway Nationalization Act [http://www.geocities.com/The Tropics/Cove/5750/history.html]、「関西鉄道が鉄道国有法の対象になる」→「関西鉄道が鉄道国有法の対象になる」ということと解釈しました。ご確認ください。
sen.e: October 1, 1907: The Kansai Railway Company became subject to the Railway Nationalization Act.
October 1, 1907: The Kansai Railway Company became subject to the Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）8月1日 京都駅～当駅間廃止（ルート変更）。
sen.e: August 1, 1921: The section between Kyoto Station and this station was disused (because of route change).
August 1, 1921: The section between Kyoto Station and this station was discontinued due to the route change.
August 1, 1921: The section between Kyoto Station and this station was discontinued due to the route change.

sen.j: 貨物駅となる。
sen.e: It became a freight station.
It became a freight station.
It became a freight station.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）9月3日 桃山駅～当駅間廃止。
sen.e: September 3, 1928: The operation between Momoyama Station and this station was discontinued.
September 3, 1928: The operation between Momoyama Station and this station was discontinued.
September 3, 1928: The operation between Momoyama Station and this station was discontinued.

sen.j: 廃駅となる。
sen.e: It became a disused station.
It became a disused station.
It became a disused station.
